title: (x) Script from Bj�rk � custom type by M/M Paris {Adriano E}
content: Does anybody knows the name of this script typeface? ![bjoerk](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22315.jpg)
author: caliban

comments.content:
I think It's a custom type made by a design company from france: M/M (Paris). It first came out on the Volumen DVD.   
   
 [M/M Paris](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607/http:/www.mmparis.com/bjorkasabook/bjorkasabook01.html)

I don't know if you are open to similar looking fonts, but there were several in the Script Guide, including this one called Little Days from West Wind Fonts that is available for free download at a number of sites, including Font Freak at [http://www.fontfreak.com/authors/west\_wind\_fonts.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607/http:/www.fontfreak.com/authors/west_wind_fonts.htm) ![Little Days sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22329.gif)
[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/westwind/index.htm) is the amended Little Days, from the source and with an explanatory note.
Thanks Mike, I couldn't get the TypOasis site to open earlier, so I used the FontFreak link.

another, more similar one, is ito:   
 [http://dafont.com/theme.php?cat=502&page=2](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607/http:/dafont.com/theme.php?cat=502&page=2)

Have you tried [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141607/http:/home4.inet.tele.dk/olrik/bjork/fonts/)?   
   
Seems to be someone who's created one based on the letters found on the Bj�rk CD/DVD -- which is what you wanted, right?
